The simultaneous opening of BASIS Independent Silicon Valley, and BASIS Independent Brooklyn is unprecedented in American private k - 12 education. Indeed these openings represent the most successful private school national launch ever.BASIS Independent Schools will now open independent schools in major metropolitan areas to fulfill its mission of bringing the highest international standards of learning to as many American students as possible. These new independent schools will offer a world quality learning experience at an exceptional value to families in high-cost metropolitan cities.These schools offer a STEM-focused liberal arts curriculum, giving students the tools they need to excel in the 21st century. Passionate subject experts challenge their students with high expectations whilst providing the highest levels of support. The school culture is entirely focused on student learning, above all on educating students so that by graduation they have come to a deep understanding of their passions and are able to make choices that might otherwise, in a traditional private school or public magnet school, be closed to them. summary: Quinton Mark Reford, D. Phil., is an international educator and school leader with experience from Moscow to Washington, D.C.  As Chief Executive Officer of BASIS Independent Schools,  in 2014 Dr. Reford was responsible for the start-up of two brand-new private schools in Brooklyn, NY, and San Jose, California, in all aspects: site location, brand, marketing and student recruitment, construction management and teacher recruitment teacher recruitment. Born and bred in Northern Ireland, he attended his local grammar school before winning a scholarship to Oxford, where he earned a Double First in English and a D. Phil on the poetry of W. B. Yeats. Dr. Reford taught English in some of the finest schools and universities in America and abroad for more than a decade.He taught at Oxford, and in the Stanford University program in Oxford. Mark lived in Moscow, witnessing the fall of the Soviet Union while teaching at The Institute for Foreign Relations and Moscow State University. He moved to America in 1993 and has since been a teacher, administrator and Head of School in some of the most outstanding independent schools in the country including Sidwell Friends School in Washington DC, where he served as Academic Dean.
